alert.note: Alert for Tusas Mountains Including Chama (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 23 at 9:21PM MST until February 24 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow. An additional inch or two of snow accumulation will be possible through the late night hours, favoring the highest peaks. Wind gusts as high as 40 mph are also expected on the highest peaks. * WHERE...Tusas Mountains Including Chama. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. Blowing snow may create areas of reduced visibilities over ridgetops and through exposed areas.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.
